verses.verse: After two days, it was the Passover and the Yeastless Loaves Festival. And the head priests and the Old Testament transcribers were looking for how, when they take Him into custody using deception, they may kill Him.
But they were saying, "Not in the festival so that there will not be a disruption of the group."

And as He was in Bethany in the house of Simon (the skin-diseased man), as He was lying back, a woman came having an alabaster jar of very expensive authentic Spikenard perfume. And after she crushed the alabaster jar, she spilled it down on His head.
There were some who were infuriated to themselves and saying, "Why has this ruining of the perfume happened?
You see, this was able to be put up for sale for over three hundred denarii ($15000) and to be given to the poor." And they were being stern with her.
But Jesus said, "Leave her alone. Why are you bothering her? She worked nice work for Me.
You see, you always have the poor with you. And whenever you want you are able to make them well, but Me you do not always have.
She did what she had. She took it beforehand to put perfume on My body for the embalming.
Amen, I tell you, whenever this good news is spoken publicly in the whole world, what she did also will be spoken for a reminder of her."
And Judas, the Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went off to the head priests so that he might turn Him in to them.
When the head priests heard it, they were happy and promised to give him silver. And he was looking for how he might turn Him in at easy times.

And for the first day of the Yeastless Loaves Festival (when they were sacrificing the Passover lamb), His students say to Him, "Where do You want that after going off we might get things ready so that you might eat the Passover meal?"
And He sends two of His students out and says to them, "Go back into the city, and a person will meet you hauling a clay pitcher of water. Follow him.
And wherever he goes in, tell the homeowner, 'The teacher says, "Where is the guest room where I might eat the Passover meal with My students?"'
And he will show you a huge room above the ground floor that has been set up, that is ready. Get ready for us there."
And His students went out, went into the city, and found it just as He told them. And they got the Passover meal ready.
And when it became evening, He came with the Twelve.
And as they reclined and ate, Jesus said, "Amen, I tell you that one from among you will turn Me in, the one eating with Me."
The students began to be sad and to be saying to Him, one by one, "It isn't me, is it?" And another, "It isn't me, is it?"
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "It is one from the Twelve, the one dipping with Me into the bowl.

The Son of the Person certainly goes back just as it has been written about Him, but what a tragedy it is to that person by whom the Son of the Person is turned in. It was nice for him if that person was not born."
And as they were eating, when Jesus took bread, after conferring prosperity on it, He tore it, gave it to them, and said, "Take it. Eat it. This is My body."
And when He took the cup, after being thankful, He gave it to them, and everyone drank from it.
And He said to them, "This is My blood, the blood of the new treaty, the blood that is spilled out concerning many.
Amen, I tell you that I will not in any way drink anymore from the produce of the vine until that day, whenever I drink it new in the empire of God."
And after they sang praise songs, they went out to the Mountain of the Olives.
And Jesus says to them, "You will all be tripped in Me in this night because it has been written, (in Zechariah 13:7) 'I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be dispersed.'
But after the time for Me to be gotten up, I will go ahead of you into Galilee."
Peter was declaring to Him, "Even if everyone will be tripped, still I will not."
And Jesus says to him, "Amen, I tell you that today, in this night, before the time for a rooster to even crow twice, three times you will flatly deny Me."
But Peter was saying much more instead, "If it is necessary for me to die together with You, I will not in any way flatly deny You." They all were also saying similarly.
And they come into a parcel of land, the name of which is Gethsemane, and He says to His students, "Be seated here while I will pray."
And He takes Peter, James, and John along with Himself. And He began to be startled and heavyhearted.
And He says to them, "My soul is overcome with sadness to death. Stay here and stay awake."
And when He went on ahead a little, He got down on the ground and was praying that, if it is possible, the hour might pass away from Him.
And He was saying, "Daddy, the Father, all things are possible for You. Carry this cup off away from Me. But not what I want. But what You want."
And He comes and finds them sleeping. And He says to Peter, "Simon, are you sleeping? Didn't you have strength to stay awake one hour?
Stay awake and pray that you will not get into trouble. The spirit certainly is eager, but the physical body is weak."
And when He went off again, He prayed when He said the same words.
And when He returned, He found them sleeping again. You see, their eyes had been weighted down, and they did not know how to respond to Him.
And He comes the third time and says to them, "Sleep the rest of the time, and relax. He has it all. The hour came. Look, the Son of the Person is turned over into the hands of the sinful people.
Get up. We should lead. Look, the person turning Me in has come near."

And right away as He is still speaking, Judas, who is one of the Twelve, shows up, and with him a big crowd with knives and wooden clubs from the side of the head priests, the Old Testament transcribers, and the older men.
The one turning Him in had given them a signal, saying, "Whoever I am friendly with is Him. Take Him into custody and lead Him away securely."
And after he came, right away when he came forward to Him, he says, "Rabbi, Rabbi," and was very friendly to Him.
The men put their hands on Him and took Him into custody.
A certain one of the students that had stood nearby, after pulling out the knife, struck the slave of the head priest and took off his ear lobe.
And when Jesus responded, He said to them, "As on a bandit, you came out with knives and wooden clubs to apprehend Me.
Daily I was close to you on the temple grounds teaching, and you did not take Me into custody. But this is happening so that the Old Testament writings might be accomplished."
And after leaving Him, everyone escaped.
And one certain young lad was following Him, a linen cloth having been put around over his naked body, and the young men take hold of him.
But the young man, after leaving the linen cloth down there, escaped away from them naked.
And they led Jesus away to the head priest. And all the head priests, the older men, and the Old Testament transcribers are coming together to Him.
And Peter followed Him off at a distance until inside, in the courtyard of the head priest. And he was sitting together with the rowers and warming himself close to the light.
The head priests and the whole council were looking for a witness account against Jesus for the "to put Him to death" part, and they were not finding one.
You see, many were lying when they were witnessing against Him, and the witness accounts were not equal.
And when some stood up, they were lying when they were witnessing against Him, saying,
"We listened to Him saying, 'I will tear down this temple, the handmade one, and through three days I will build another not handmade.'"
And like this neither was their witness account equal.
And after the head priest stood up in the middle, he asked Jesus, saying, "Are You not answering anything? What are these people witnessing against You?"
But Jesus was being silent and answered nothing. Again the head priest was asking Him. And he says to Him, "Are You the Anointed King, the Son of the One conferred with prosperity?"
Jesus said, "I am, and you will see the Son of the Person sitting at places to the right of the Ability and coming with the clouds of the sky."
After the head priest rips apart his long undershirt, he says, "What? Do we still have a need for witnesses?
You listened to the hurtful comment. How does it appear to you?" The men all found Him guilty to be confined for death.
And some began to be spitting at Him, to be blindfolding His face, to be slugging Him, and to be saying to Him, "Prophesy." And the rowers were taking Him with slaps.
And as Peter is in the courtyard below, one of the servant girls of the head priest comes.
And when she sees Peter warming himself, after looking at him, she says, "You also were with the Nazarene, Jesus."
But Peter denied it, saying, "I do not know nor am even aware of what you are saying." And he went outside into the front yard, and a rooster crowed.
And when the servant girl saw him again, she began to be saying to the people who had stood nearby, "This person is from them."

But Peter again was denying it. And again after a little while, the people who had stood nearby were saying to Peter, "You are truly from them. You see, you are even a Galilean, and your speech is similar."
But Peter began to be vowing under the penalty of being doomed and to be guaranteeing, "I do not know this person whom you are saying."

And from a second time a rooster crowed, and Peter was reminded again of the statement that Jesus said to him, "Before the time for a rooster to crow twice, three times you will flatly deny Me." And when he tossed it over in his mind, he was crying.
